channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The baby swing has mould all over it, 13th August
item.description:
The swing has mould on the orange part all over. Just worried as it’s a baby swing right near where baby’s touch to hold on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Human waste/drugs/clothes, 13th August
item.description:

item.title: Large piece of wood, 13th August
item.description:
Large piece of wood, actually in the road by the kerb. Difficult for a car to park there. It’s right outside Bostall library. A number of elderly people go there and like to park outside. This would be a hazard for them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westbourne Road, West Heath, London

item.title: Items Outside Number 20 Chesterfield Grove, 13th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Street trees in well rd outside 14 20 21 22, 13th August
item.description:
No recent maintenance, trees now grown way too large and need pruning back. Sap that falls is terrible for my husband's asthma.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Well Road, Belsize Park, London

item.title: Mattress, garden waste, mobility furniture & other, 13th August
item.description:
An assortment of rubbish dumped at end of Shafton Road (Cemetery end NOT Victoria Park end) It’s not safe and it’s really unsightly. Children play in the road. This is stopping them from playing football etc

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shafton Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Issue still ongoing with fly tipping., 13th August
item.description:
You closed my last report concerning this dishwasher which was fly tipped. I am unsatisfied with your response. Who is the non-local authority or privately owned/operated organisation responsible for removing this item? (I have CCTV evidence of exactly who did the fly tipping). I understand that fly tipping is a criminal offence so please advise what I, a private resident, need to do to resolve this matter if you feel it is not within your jurisdiction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 110-112, Tower Bridge Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple shopping trolleys dumped on pavement, 13th August
item.description:
Multiple shopping trolleys vandalised and dumped blocking the pavement and looking unsightly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halcot Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes and scooters on the Narrow Way, 13th August
item.description:
The Narrow Way is an absolute nightmare. Had to dodge Lime Bikes and delivery scooters the whole time. I thought this was supposed to be a pedestrian area. If bikes are going to use the area why not put in a dedicated cycle lane.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
